intro: Didymocarpus payapensis, commonly known as the Payapensis mangosteen, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy fruits that are typically eaten raw or used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and commercial purposes.
